Class
Description

9x9 Tiles matrix that represents the configuration of the Board when there are 2 players

9x9 Tiles matrix that represents the configuration of the Board when there are 3 players

B4P
9x9 Tiles matrix that represents the configuration of the Board when there are 4 players
B4PTest
 
Board
Matrix that represents the LivingRoom of the game.
BoardRefill
BoardRefill Message: notifies a TCP client that the LivingRoom Board was refilled.
BoardUpdateMessage
BoardUpdate Message: notifies a TCP client that the LivingRoom Board was updated.
Chat
Class that manages the client's chat
ChatTest
 
ChatUpdate
ChatUpdate Message: notifies a TCP client that his chat now contains more messages.
ChooseColumnRequest
TCP message used for sending to the server the client's column chosen
Cli
Class that represent the TUI
Client
Main class for the Client, Instances either ClientTCP or ClientRMIApp Instances either GUI classes or CLI.
ClientInputReader
Class that manages what the client's writes in the TUI
ClientInterface
Interface that ClientRMI and ClientTCP implements
ClientRMIApp
Class of the clients which choose to connect via RMI
ClientTCP
Class of the clients which choose to connect via TCP
ClientTCPHandler
Class that manages the communication from the ClientTCP and the ServerTCP
CommonDeck
Class used to instantiate the common cards for the game
CommonGoalCard
Abstract class for the common goal cards
CommonGroup1
Class used to handle cards 1 and 10
CommonGroup1Test
 
CommonGroup2
Class used to handle cards 2,5,6,7

Class used to handle cards 3 and 4

Class used to handle cards 8 and 11

Class used to handle card 9

CommonGroup6
Class used to handle card 12
CommonGroup6Test
 
CreateGameRequest
TCP message used for sending to the server the client's username, and it's choice of the players number in that game
CreateGameResponse
CreateGameResponse Message: notifies a TCP client that he successfully created a new game.
CreateGameViewController
Controller of the "CreateGame" scene that is seen when the player choose to create a new game
DrawnCommonCardsMessage
DrawnCommonCards Message: notifies a TCP client about which CommonCards were extracted.
DrawnPersonalCardMessage
DrawnPersonalCard Message: notifies a TCP client about which PersonalCard was extracted.
EmptyNicknameException
Exception that is thrown when a client's nickname is empty
EndGameController
Controller of the "End Game" scene that is seen when the game ends and give the possibility to the clients to restart a new game o join a new one
EndTokenTakenMessage
EndToken Message: notifies a TCP client about which player completed his shelfie first.
EndTurnController
Controller of the "End Turn" scene that is seen when it's another client's turn of the game
ErrorMessage
Error Message: contains a string that explains the error that has just occurred.
ExistingNicknameException
Exception that is thrown when the client's nickname already exist in the lobby
FinalPointsMessage
FinalPoints Message: notifies a TCP client about the last points in order to print the final leaderboard.
FullGameException
Exception that is thrown when a game is full and a client wants to join that game
Game
Class used to Store the information about a single match and its players.
GameController
Main Controller of the project.
GameControllerTest
 
GameStage
GameStage is used alongside the TurnStages enumeration to keep a record of the current Stage of the Game.
GameViewController
Controller of GameTurn that manages the client's turn and all of its operation
GUIApplication
Class of the GUI that manages the flow of the game in the GUI
GUIHandler
Class that manages the communication between the server and the client that choose GUI
GuiInterface
Interface used to abstract GUI controllers
GUILauncher
Launcher of the GUI
IllegalValueException
Exception that is thrown when some value it's not admissible
InvalidIDException
Exception that is thrown when thc clients wants to join a game that has a non-existing ID
JoinGameController
Controller of the "Join game" scene where the client has to write the game ID of the game it wants to connect
JoinGameRequest
TCP message used for sending to the server the client's username, and it's choice of the game ID to join
JoinGameResponse
JoinGame Message: notifies a TCP client that he correctly joined a game.
Launch
Jar Application Launcher.
Lobby
Class that manages the client's when they aren't yet in a game on when they finish a game
LobbyStub
 
LobbyTest
 
LoginController
Controller of the Login scene that it's visualized when a client connects to the server; here te client has ti write its nickname and choose between create or join a game
LoginRequest
TCP message used for sending to the server the client's username when it connects
LoginResponse
LoginResponse Message: notifies a TCP client that his login was successful.
Message
Message Class.
MessageType
 
NotTcpUserException
Exception thrown whenever a TCP client isn't found online
NoTurnSetter
NoTurnSetter Message: sets a TCP client's stage to NOTURN.
Payload
Payload class: is the messages' body.
PersonalGoalCard
Class that manages personal goal cards and their points
PersonalGoalCardsTest
 
PingMessage
Ping Message: empty message which is used for checking if a TCP client is till online.
PointsUpdateMessage
PointsUpdate Message: notifies a TCP client about notifies a TCP client about the latest players' points.
PongMessage
Pong Message: empty message which is used for confirming that a TCP client is till online.
PossibleColors
Enumeration used to define all possible colors of the tiles
PossibleColumnsResponse
PossibleColumnsResponse Message: notifies a TCP client sending the empty columns of his shelfie.
RemoteInterface
Interface that ClientRMI and ClientTCPHandler implements
RemoteInterfaceStub
 
RestartMessage
Restart Message: asks a TCP client whether he wants to play again after a finished match.
RMIImplementation
Class that implements the methods for the RMI connection
SelectedTilesRequest
TCP message used for sending to the server the client's List of Tiles that it wants to take
SendChatMessage
TCP message used for sending to the server the client's public chat message that it wants to send
SendPrivateChatMessage
TCP message used for sending to the server the client's username, the private chat message that it wants to send, and the receiver of the message
Server
Main class of the Server Instances the ServerRMI, the ServerTCP and the Lobby
ServerInterface
Interface that ServerRMI implements
ServerTCP
Class that implements the methods for the TCP connection
Shelfie
Class used to represent the BookShelf in the game.
ShelfieTest
 
ShelfieUpdateMessage
ShelfieUpdate Message: notifies a TCP client that a shelfie was updated.
StartOrderMessage
StartOrder Message: sends to the TCP client the players' order.
StartTurnMessage
StartTurn Message: notifies a TCP client that his turn just started.
TakeableTilesResponse
TakeAbleTiles Message: sets a TCP client's take-able tiles.
TestB4P
 
TestCli
 
ThisNotTheDay
TCP Message: empty message which is used for recovering a TCP client's data after a reconnection.
Tile
Class that manages the Tiles in the Living Room and in the Bookshelves
TilesBag
Class that represent the bag where the Tiles are
TilesBagTest
 
TilesNumRequest
TCP message used for sending to the server the client's choice of the number of tiles that it wants to take
TurnStages
Enumeration that manages the stages of the client from when it connects to when it disconnects
User
User class: For each player, one instance of the User class is created; it contains instances of chat and shelfie.
UserTest
 
ViewInterface
View Interface.
ViewUpdate
ViewUpdate Message: forces a TCP client to update the view scene.
VirtualView
Class that manages the communication of the controllers with the clients
VirtualViewStub
 
WrongListException
Exception that is thrown when the client wants to take a list of Tiles that he can't choose
WrongPlayerException
Exception that is thrown when a client tries to make an action when it's not its turn
WrongTileException
Exception that is thrown when the client wants to take more tiles than it choose before
